com.beaglebuddy.id3.v23.frame_body

Class ID3v23FrameBodyUtility

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.beaglebuddy.util.Utility
      • com.beaglebuddy.id3.v23.frame_body.ID3v23FrameBodyUtility
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ID3v23FrameBody

    public class ID3v23FrameBodyUtility
extends Utility
    Base class for the body of ID3V2.3 frames. This class is simply a collection of utility methods and is not a frame body type.
    See Also:
    ID3 tag version 2.3.0 standard, wikipedia history of ID3 tags

    • Method Detail

      • getNextNullTerminator

        public static int getNextNullTerminator(byte[] buffer,
                        int startingFrom,
                        Encoding encoding)
        finds the next null terminating character in the raw data stream according to the specified character encoding. A null character is represented as a single 0x00 byte in some character encodings and as two bytes 0x00 0x00 in others.
        Parameters:
        buffer - the raw binary bytes in which to find the next null terminator character.
        startingFrom - the index at which to start searching from in the data.
        encoding - the character set used to encode the string (and hence determine the null terminating character).

        Returns:
        the index of the next null terminator in the data.

      • stringToBytes

        public static byte[] stringToBytes(Encoding encoding,
                   java.lang.String string)
        converts a String to a byte array using a specified character set encoding. The String class has a getBytes() method, but that method does not include a null terminator in the byte array that it returns. This method does.
        Parameters:
        encoding - the encoding to use when converting the string to a byte array.
        string - the string to be converted to a byte array.
        Returns:
        a byte array holding the string value in the specified encoding with null terminating bytes.

      • pricesToString

        public static java.lang.String pricesToString(java.util.List<Price> prices)
        convert a list of prices to a string, with each price separated by the "/" character.
        example: USD0.99/EUR1.00/GBP0.65
        Parameters:
        prices - list of prices.
        Returns:
        a string representation of the list of price(s).
